00022 #ifndef _USB_VHCI_H
00023 #define _USB_VHCI_H
00024 
00025 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00026 #   include <linux/types.h>
00027 #else
00028 #   include <stdint.h>
00029 #   define __u8 uint8_t
00030 #   define __s8 int8_t
00031 #   define __u16 uint16_t
00032 #   define __s16 int16_t
00033 #   define __u32 uint32_t
00034 #   define __s32 int32_t
00035 #   define __u64 uint64_t
00036 #   define __s64 int64_t
00037 #endif
00038 #include <linux/ioctl.h>
00039 
00040 #ifndef __KERNEL__
00041 
00042 // wPortStatus bit field
00043 // See USB 2.0 spec Table 11-21
00044 #define USB_PORT_STAT_CONNECTION    0x0001
00045 #define USB_PORT_STAT_ENABLE        0x0002
00046 #define USB_PORT_STAT_SUSPEND       0x0004
00047 #define USB_PORT_STAT_OVERCURRENT   0x0008
00048 #define USB_PORT_STAT_RESET         0x0010
00049 #define USB_PORT_STAT_POWER         0x0100
00050 #define USB_PORT_STAT_LOW_SPEED     0x0200
00051 #define USB_PORT_STAT_HIGH_SPEED    0x0400
00052 //#define USB_PORT_STAT_TEST          0x0800
00053 //#define USB_PORT_STAT_INDICATOR     0x1000
00054 
00055 // wPortChange bit field
00056 // See USB 2.0 spec Table 11-22
00057 #define USB_PORT_STAT_C_CONNECTION  0x0001
00058 #define USB_PORT_STAT_C_ENABLE      0x0002
00059 #define USB_PORT_STAT_C_SUSPEND     0x0004
00060 #define USB_PORT_STAT_C_OVERCURRENT 0x0008
00061 #define USB_PORT_STAT_C_RESET       0x0010
00062 
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 // structure for the USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER ioctl
00066 struct usb_vhci_ioc_register
00067 {
00068     __s32 id;         // [out] identifier which was assigned by the kernel
00069     __s32 usb_busnum; // [out] assigned USB bus number
00070     char bus_id[20];  // [out] null-terminated bus-id of the controller
00071                       //       (something similar to vhci_hcd.<id>)
00072     __u8 port_count;  // [in]  number of ports the controller should have
00073 };
00074 
00075 struct usb_vhci_ioc_port_stat
00076 {
00077     __u16 status;    // state of the port
00078     __u16 change;    // indicates changed status bits
00079     __u8 index;      // index of port
00080     __u8 flags;      // additional information from kernel to user space:
00081 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_PORT_STAT_FLAGS_RESUMING 0x01 // indicates resuming
00082     __u8 reserved1, reserved2; // size of the struct should be dividable by four
00083 };
00084 
00085 struct usb_vhci_ioc_setup_packet
00086 {
00087     __u8 bmRequestType;
00088     __u8 bRequest;
00089     __u16 wValue;
00090     __u16 wIndex;
00091     __u16 wLength;
00092 };
00093 
00094 struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb
00095 {
00096     struct usb_vhci_ioc_setup_packet setup_packet; // only for control urbs
00097     __s32 buffer_length;                           // number of bytes which were
00098                                                    // allocated for the buffer
00099     __s32 interval;
00100     __s32 packet_count;                            // number of iso packets
00101     __u16 flags;                                   // flags:
00102 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_SHORT_NOT_OK 0x0001 // IN: treat incomming short
00103                                                    // packets as an error
00104 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_ISO_ASAP     0x0002 // ISO: schedule as soon as
00105                                                    // possible
00106 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_FLAGS_ZERO_PACKET  0x0040 // BULK OUT: always send a
00107                                                    // short packet at the end
00108                                                    // (send a zero length packet
00109                                                    // if necessary)
00110     __u8 address;                                  // address of the usb device
00111                                                    // for which this urb is for
00112     __u8 endpoint;                                 // endpoint incl. direction
00113     __u8 type;
00114 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_ISO     0
00115 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_INT     1
00116 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_CONTROL 2
00117 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_URB_TYPE_BULK    3
00118 };
00119 
00120 union usb_vhci_ioc_work_union
00121 {
00122     struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb urb;             // for USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PROCESS_URB
00123     struct usb_vhci_ioc_port_stat port;      // for USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PORT_STAT
00124 };
00125 
00126 struct usb_vhci_ioc_work
00127 {
00128     __u64 handle;                            // for USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PROCESS_URB
00129                                              // and USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_CANCEL_URB;
00130                                              // handle which identifies the urb
00131                                              // (it is just a pointer to the urb
00132                                              // in kernel space)
00133     union usb_vhci_ioc_work_union work;
00134     __s16 timeout;                           // timeout in milliseconds (max. 1000)
00135 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_TIMEOUT_INFINITE     -1
00136     __u8 type;
00137 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PORT_STAT   0 // the state of a port has changed
00138 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_PROCESS_URB 1 // hand an urb to the (virtual)
00139                                              // hardware
00140 #define USB_VHCI_IOC_WORK_TYPE_CANCEL_URB  2 // cancel urb if it isn't processed
00141                                              // already
00142 };
00143 
00144 struct usb_vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data
00145 {
00146     __u32 offset;
00147     __u32 packet_length;
00148 };
00149 
00150 struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb_data
00151 {
00152     __u64 handle;        // handle which identifies the urb
00153     void *buffer;        // points to the beginning of the data buffer
00154     struct usb_vhci_ioc_iso_packet_data *iso_packets; // points to the beginning of
00155                                                       // the iso packet array
00156     __s32 buffer_length; // number of bytes which were allocated for the buffer
00157     __s32 packet_count;  // number of iso packets
00158 };
00159 
00160 struct usb_vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback
00161 {
00162     __u32 packet_actual;
00163     __s32 status;
00164 };
00165 
00166 struct usb_vhci_ioc_giveback
00167 {
00168     __u64 handle;
00169     void *buffer;        // only for IN URBs: the received data (for OUT URBs
00170                          // always a null pointer)
00171     struct usb_vhci_ioc_iso_packet_giveback *iso_packets; // for ISO
00172     __s32 status;        // (ignored for ISO URBs)
00173     __s32 buffer_actual; // number of bytes which were actually transfered
00174                          // (for IN-ISOs buffer_actual has to be equal to
00175                          // buffer_length; for OUT-ISOs this value will be
00176                          // ignored)
00177     __s32 packet_count;  // for ISO (has to match with the value from the urb)
00178     __s32 error_count;   // for ISO
00179 };
00180 
00181 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00182 #ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT
00183 #include <linux/compat.h>
00184 struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb_data32
00185 {
00186     __u64 handle;
00187     compat_caddr_t buffer;
00188     compat_caddr_t iso_packets;
00189     __s32 buffer_length;
00190     __s32 packet_count;
00191 };
00192 
00193 struct usb_vhci_ioc_giveback32
00194 {
00195     __u64 handle;
00196     compat_caddr_t buffer;
00197     compat_caddr_t iso_packets;
00198     __s32 status;
00199     __s32 buffer_actual;
00200     __s32 packet_count;
00201     __s32 error_count;
00202 };
00203 #endif
00204 #endif
00205 
00206 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC       138
00207 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCREGISTER     _IOWR(USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 0, \
00208                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_register)
00209 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCPORTSTAT     _IOW (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 1, \
00210                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_port_stat)
00211 // read-only FETCH_WORK: timeout defaults to 100 ms
00212 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK_RO _IOR (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 2, \
00213                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_work)
00214 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHWORK    _IOWR(USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 2, \
00215                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_work)
00216 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK     _IOW (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 3, \
00217                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_giveback)
00218 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCGIVEBACK32   _IOW (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 3, \
00219                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_giveback32)
00220 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA    _IOW (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 4, \
00221                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb_data)
00222 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOCFETCHDATA32  _IOW (USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAGIC, 4, \
00223                                        struct usb_vhci_ioc_urb_data32)
00224 #define USB_VHCI_HCD_IOC_MAXNR       4
00225 
00226 #endif
